gdm_apps_legal.gdm_terms_of_use_content:
GDm-Health App TERMS OF USE

Please read these terms of use (this 'Agreement') carefully as you will be bound by this Agreement if you use or access the GDm-Health mobile application ('GDm-Health App'). If you enter into this Agreement on behalf of another person (natural or legal) you warrant that you have authority to do so. We also draw your attention to terms numbered 4, 5 and 6 below, which explain the limitations which apply to our liability to you and your liability to us in connection with the GDm-Health App.

1 THIS AGREEMENT

1.1 The GDm-Health App is made available to you on behalf of your NHS Trust by Sensyne Health. Sensyne Health is the trading name for Sensyne Health Group Limited, incorporated in England (company number 11240986) with its registered office at Schrödinger Building, Heatley Road, Oxford Science Park, Oxford, OX4 4GE ('Sensyne', 'we', 'us'). In this Agreement, a reference to 'you' means you, in your capacity as a patient of a NHS Trust for whom Sensyne processes certain data in connection with the NHS Trust's provision of care to patients. You can contact us by emailing our customer service team at support@sensynehealth.com or writing to us at the address above. If we have to contact you we may do so using the email address, postal address or telephone number you provided to us.

1.2 We reserve the right to make changes to this Agreement at any time, in accordance with applicable legislation. If we make only minor changes to this Agreement without materially changing your rights or obligations such amended Agreement shall be posted on the GDm-Health App or through some other reasonable method and they shall take effect immediately when they are posted. If you do not accept any change, then you are free to terminate the agreement with us and stop using the GDm-Health App. Your use of the GDm-Health App following notification of a material change to you shall constitute your acceptance of those changes. Certain provisions of this Agreement may be supplemented or superseded by expressly designated legal notices or terms located on particular pages within the GDm-Health App and we will use reasonable efforts to make you aware of such legal notices and/or terms.

2 LICENCE AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY ('IP')

2.1 We grant you a personal, non-transferable and non-exclusive right and licence to access and use the GDm-Health App for your personal and non-commercial use and for its intended use only. Any software provided through or used to operate the GDm-Health App is licensed, not sold, to you by us and such licence is limited to object code only. We may notify you, by notice within the software or otherwise, that the software contains software governed by the licence of a third party and you agree to abide by the terms and condition of the same.

2.2 You must not rent, lease, lend, sell, redistribute, sublicense, copy, reverse engineer, decompile, translate, modify, rent, use as a service bureau, lease, sublicense, distribute copies of, adapt, or create derivative works based on such software, without prejudice to your rights to make a back-up copy of, or decompile such software in the circumstances provided by sections 50A and 50B of the UK Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988 (or similar rights under any applicable law which may not be excluded by contract).

2.3 The trade marks 'GDm', 'GDm-Health' and any other trade mark used in the GDm-Health App are our trademarks or those of our licensors and you may not use or display such trade marks without our permission.

2.4 With respect to content you submit or make available through the GDm-Health App that is not personal data ('User Content'), you grant us a worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free and non-exclusive license to use such User Content for the purpose of providing the GDm-Health App.

3 YOUR OBLIGATIONS

To use the GDm-Health App, your Trust administrator must complete a registration form or a similar form to create an account. When you access your account you agree to provide true, accurate, current and complete information about yourself as prompted by the registration form or otherwise requested during the term of this Agreement, and to maintain and promptly update that information.

You agree not to use the GDm-Health App to: (a) upload, post, email, transmit or otherwise make available any content that is unlawful, harmful, threatening, abusive, harassing, tortious, defamatory, vulgar, obscene, libelous, invasive of another's privacy, hateful, or racially, ethnically or otherwise illegal or objectionable; (b) impersonate any person or entity, including, but not limited to, a Sensyne employee or falsely state or otherwise misrepresent your affiliation with a person or entity; (c) transmit or otherwise make available any content that you do not have a right to make available, that contains software viruses or any other computer code, files or programs designed to interrupt, destroy or limit the functionality of any computer software or hardware or telecommunications equipment; (d) interfere with or disrupt the GDm-Health App or servers or networks connected to the GDm-Health App; and/or (e) violate any applicable local, state, national or international law.

You are solely responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your information and for restricting access to your devices. You accept responsibility for all activities that occur under your account or from your devices. We shall use reasonable and industry-standard security measures to protect against unauthorised access to your account. You agree to immediately notify us of any unauthorised use or your account or password, or any other breach of security, and acknowledge that we may not be able to mitigate such unauthorised access or other breach of security until you do so.

4 WARRANTIES AND DISCLAIMER

We make no representation or warranty other than as expressly set out in this agreement. To the extent permitted by law, we disclaim and exclude all conditions or warranties that may otherwise be implied by law into this agreement including without limitation warranties as to title or non infringement, all services are provided on an 'as is' basis and we do not warrant that the GDm-Health App shall be available at all times, or is free of errors.

You expressly agree that Sensyne is not providing, and does not intend to provide, medical advice through the GDm-Health App and that this is the responsibility of your physician or other medical professionals. The GDm-Health App (including any generic content supplied within the GDm-Health App) is not intended to be used in place of (a) the advice of your physician or other medical professionals, or (b) a visit, call or consultation with your physician or other medical professionals. Should you have any health related issues or questions during your use of the GDm-Health App, please call or see your physician or other healthcare provider promptly. The GDm-Health App does not constitute or create a doctor-patient, therapist-patient or other healthcare professional relationship between you and Sensyne.

5 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

5.1 Nothing in this Agreement shall limit or exclude any liability that, under applicable law, cannot be limited or excluded, including liability for death or personal injury caused by our negligence, liability for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation.

5.2 If we fail to comply with this agreement, we are responsible for loss or damage you suffer that is a foreseeable result of our breaking this contract or our failing to use reasonable care and skill, but we are not responsible for any loss or damage that is not foreseeable or that is otherwise indirect or consequential. Loss or damage is foreseeable if either it is obvious that it will happen or if, at the time the contract was made, both we and you knew it might happen. In no circumstance will we be liable for any loss of profit, goodwill, revenue, anticipated savings, or any loss or corruption of data. To the maximum extent permitted by law, our aggregate liability under this Agreement is limited to £100.

6 INDEMNITY

6.1 You promise to compensate us fully against any claim or demand, including reasonable legal fees, made by any third party due to or arising out of your use of the GDm-Health App, your breach of this Agreement, or your violation of any rights of another person or entity.

7 TERMINATION AND SUSPENSION

7.1 You may terminate this Agreement any time by contacting your NHS Trust midwife or care team. They will be responsible for removing you, and any of your data, from the GDm-Health App. If you terminate your agreement you will no longer be able to use the GDm-Health App.

7.2 We may terminate this Agreement and/or your access to the GDm-Health App immediately where we have reasonable ground to so due to: (i) your breach of this Agreement; (ii) requests by law enforcement or other government agencies; (iii) our discontinuance of or material modification to the GDm-Health App; (iv) unexpected technical or security issues or problems; and (v) your extended periods of inactivity. Termination of your account may include (i) removal of access to all offerings within the GDm-Health App, (ii) deletion of your information, files and content associated with or inside your account, and (iii) barring of further use of the GDm-Health App. You agree that all such suspension, change or termination by us shall be made in our sole discretion and that to the extent permitted by applicable law we shall not be liable to you or any third party for any suspension, change or termination of your account or access to the GDm-Health App for any reason.

8 GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTES

8.1 This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of England (or the laws of Scotland or Northern Ireland if you are a consumer and live there) and the courts of London, England (or courts of Scotland or Northern Ireland if you are a consumer and live there) shall have exclusive jurisdiction.

8.2 If you are a consumer located in Europe, you may also be able to refer a dispute to the European Online Dispute Resolution ('ODR') platform at http://ec.europa.eu/odr. This link is provided as required by Regulation (EU) 524/2013 or the European Parliament and of the Council, for information purposes only. We are not obliged to participate in online dispute resolution.

9 GENERAL

9.1 This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between you and us relating to its subject matter and supersedes any prior agreements, undertakings, representations, warranties and arrangements of any nature, relating to the same. Each party acknowledges that it has not been induced to enter into this Agreement by any representation or warranty other than those contained in this Agreement.

9.2 You must not use, export or re-export any Services contrary to the export laws of the UK, USA and any other jurisdiction including without limitation the Export Administration Regulations of the USA ('Export Laws').

9.3 We may assign this Agreement, in whole or in part without notice to you or your consent. No person who is not a party to this Agreement shall have any rights under any law (including the UK Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999) to enforce any term of this Agreement and no consent is required from any third party to change this Agreement. We shall not be in breach of this Agreement or otherwise liable to you as a result of any delay or failure in the performance of our obligations under this Agreement to the extent that such delay or failure is caused by occurrences beyond our reasonable control including, but not limited to, acts of God, strikes, war or sabotage ('Force Majeure') and the time for performance of the relevant obligation shall be extended accordingly. No failure or delay by us to exercise or enforce any right or benefit under this Agreement shall be deemed a waiver of such right or benefit, nor operate to prevent or limit the future exercise or enforcement of that right or benefit. If any term or condition of this Agreement is held invalid, void or otherwise unenforceable by any court, governmental agency or authority of competent jurisdiction, the remainder of this Agreement shall remain valid and enforceable. The parties are independent contractors and nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed to create any joint venture or agency relationship among the parties, and no party shall have the right to enter into contracts on behalf of, to legally bind, to incur debt on behalf of, or to otherwise incur any liability or obligation on behalf of, the other party.

Contact Us:

If you have an inquiry regarding the GDm-Health App, please contact us as follows:

Address: Schrödinger Building Heatley Road, Oxford Science Park, Oxford, England, OX4 4GE

Email: gdm-support@sensynehealth.com

Updated 23 June 2020
gdm_apps_legal.gdm_patient_notice_content:
GDm-Health App NOTICE TO NHS PATIENTS

Sensyne Health Group Limited ('Sensyne') provides certain services to NHS Trusts to support the delivery of patient care by a NHS Trust to patients at risk of gestational diabetes during pregnancy.

Please note that the collection and use of your personal data will be subject to any applicable privacy policies and disclosures of your NHS Trust.

Here is some key information about this app:

- The GDm-Health App allows you to enter blood glucose readings and record extra information about your reading (e.g. a note to your nurse). This information is sent by the app to your NHS Trust.;

- You must ensure that your device has a lock. This is to protect your information.

- Your NHS Trust will have access to your personal data. Your NHS Trust may contact you using the GDm-Health app.

- Sensyne may access your personal data to provide the GDm-Health App to your NHS Trust.

- Sensyne may also have access to anonymous non-personal data generated in connection with the GDm-Health App. This data may only be used for medical research purposes or for product improvement.

- Sensyne will not use your personal data to market any products or services to you.

- Please contact your NHS Trust if you have any concerns in relation to the collection and use of your data
gdm_apps_legal.gdm_clinician_terms_content:
GDm-Health App NOTICE TO NHS AUTHORISED USERS

Sensyne Health plc ('Sensyne') provides certain services to your NHS Trust to support the delivery of patient care by your NHS Trust to patients at risk of gestational diabetes during pregnancy. Your use of the web-based GDm-Health service and any associated content (the 'GDm-Health Solution') is governed by the agreement between by Sensyne and your NHS Trust (the 'Agreement'). By using or accessing the GDm- Health Solution you agree to be bound by and comply with the terms of the Agreement as it relates your use of the GDm-Health Solution. Please contact your NHS Trust for further details.

GDm-Health App TERMS OF USE

In this Agreement, a reference to 'you' means you, in your capacity as a patient of a NHS Trust for whom Sensyne processes certain data in connection with the NHS Trust's provision of care to patients. You can contact us by emailing our customer service team at support@sensynehealth.com or writing to us at the address above. If we have to contact you we may do so using the email address, postal address or telephone number you provided to us.

1.2 We reserve the right to make changes to this Agreement at any time, in accordance with applicable legislation. If we make only minor changes to this Agreement without materially changing your rights or obligations such amended Agreement shall be posted on the GDm-Health App or through some other reasonable method and they shall take effect immediately when they are posted. If you do not accept any change, then you are free to terminate the agreement with us and stop using the GDm-Health App. Your use of the GDm-Health App following notification of a material change to you shall constitute your acceptance of those changes. Certain provisions of this Agreement may be supplemented or superseded by expressly designated legal notices or terms located on particular pages within the GDm-Health App and we will use reasonable efforts to make you aware of such legal notices and/or terms.

2 LICENCE AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY ('IP')

2.1 We grant you a personal, non-transferable and non-exclusive right and licence to access and use the GDm-Health App for your personal and non-commercial use and for its intended use only. Any software provided through or used to operate the GDm-Health App is licensed, not sold, to you by us and such licence is limited to object code only. We may notify you, by notice within the software or otherwise, that the software contains software governed by the licence of a third party and you agree to abide by the terms and condition of the same.

2.2 You must not rent, lease, lend, sell, redistribute, sublicense, copy, reverse engineer, decompile, translate, modify, rent, use as a service bureau, lease, sublicense, distribute copies of, adapt, or create derivative works based on such software, without prejudice to your rights to make a back-up copy of, or decompile such software in the circumstances provided by sections 50A and 50B of the UK Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988 (or similar rights under any applicable law which may not be excluded by contract).

2.3 The trade marks 'GDm', 'GDm-Health' and any other trade mark used in the GDm-Health App are our trademarks or those of our licensors and you may not use or display such trade marks without our permission.

2.4 With respect to content you submit or make available through the GDm-Health App ('User Content'), you grant us a worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free and non-exclusive license to use such User Content for the purpose of providing the GDm-Health App.

3 YOUR OBLIGATIONS

To use the GDm-Health App, your Trust administrator must complete a registration form or a similar form to create an account. When you access your account you agree to provide true, accurate, current and complete information about yourself as prompted by the registration form or otherwise requested during the term of this Agreement, and to maintain and promptly update that information.

You agree not to use the GDm-Health App to: (a) upload, post, email, transmit or otherwise make available any content that is unlawful, harmful, threatening, abusive, harassing, tortious, defamatory, vulgar, obscene, libelous, invasive of another's privacy, hateful, or racially, ethnically or otherwise illegal or objectionable; (b) impersonate any person or entity, including, but not limited to, a Sensyne employee or falsely state or otherwise misrepresent your affiliation with a person or entity; (c) transmit or otherwise make available any content that you do not have a right to make available, that contains software viruses or any other computer code, files or programs designed to interrupt, destroy or limit the functionality of any computer software or hardware or telecommunications equipment; (d) interfere with or disrupt the GDm-Health App or servers or networks connected to the GDm-Health App; and/or (e) violate any applicable local, state, national or international law.

The GDm-Health App does not constitute or create a doctor-patient, therapist-patient or other healthcare professional relationship between you and Sensyne.

In no circumstance will we be liable for any loss of profit, goodwill, revenue, anticipated savings, or any loss or corruption of data. 7 TERMINATION AND SUSPENSION

7.1 You may terminate this Agreement any time by contacting your NHS Trust midwife or care team. They will be responsible for removing you, and any of your data, from the GDm-Health App. If you terminate your agreement you will no longer be able to use the GDm-Health App.

Termination of your account may include (i) removal of access to all offerings within the GDm-Health App, (ii) deletion of your information, files and content associated with or inside your account, and (iii) barring of further use of the GDm-Health App. You agree that all such suspension, change or termination by us shall be made in our sole discretion and that to the extent permitted by applicable law we shall not be liable to you or any third party for any suspension, change or termination of your account or access to the GDm-Health App for any reason.

8 GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTES

8.1 This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of England (or the laws of Scotland or Northern Ireland if you are a consumer and live there) and the courts of London, England (or courts of Scotland or Northern Ireland if you are a consumer and live there) shall have exclusive jurisdiction.

8.2 If you are a consumer located in Europe, you may also be able to refer a dispute to the European Online Dispute Resolution ('ODR') platform at http://ec.europa.eu/odr. 9.2 You must not use, export or re-export any Services contrary to the export laws of the UK, USA and any other jurisdiction including without limitation the Export Administration Regulations of the USA ('Export Laws').

9.3 We may assign this Agreement, in whole or in part without notice to you or your consent. Termination of your account may include (i) removal of access to all offerings within the DBm-Health App, (ii) deletion of your information, files and content associated with or inside your account, and (iii) barring of further use of the DBm-Health App. You agree that all such suspension, change or termination by us shall be made in our sole discretion and that to the extent permitted by applicable law we shall not be liable to you or any third party for any suspension, change or termination of your account or access to the DBm-Health App for any reason.

8 GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTES

8.1 This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of England (or the laws of Scotland or Northern Ireland if you are a consumer and live there) and the courts of London, England (or courts of Scotland or Northern Ireland if you are a consumer and live there) shall have exclusive jurisdiction.

8.2 If you are a consumer located in Europe, you may also be able to refer a dispute to the European Online Dispute Resolution ('ODR') platform at http://ec.europa.eu/odr. This link is provided as required by Regulation (EU) 524/2013 or the European Parliament and of the Council, for information purposes only. We are not obliged to participate in online dispute resolution.

9 GENERAL

9.1 This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between you and us relating to its subject matter and supersedes any prior agreements, undertakings, representations, warranties, and arrangements of any nature, relating to the same. Each party acknowledges that it has not been induced to enter into this Agreement by any representation or warranty other than those contained in this Agreement.

9.2 You must not use, export or re-export any Services contrary to the export laws of the UK, USA and any other jurisdiction including without limitation the Export Administration Regulations of the USA ('Export Laws').

9.3 We may assign this Agreement, in whole or in part without notice to you or your consent. No person who is not a party to this Agreement shall have any rights under any law (including the UK Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999) to enforce any term of this Agreement and no consent is required from any third party to change this Agreement. We shall not be in breach of this Agreement or otherwise liable to you as a result of any delay or failure in the performance of our obligations under this Agreement to the extent that such delay or failure is caused by occurrences beyond our reasonable control including, but not limited to, acts of God, strikes, war or sabotage ('Force Majeure') and the time for performance of the relevant obligation shall be extended accordingly. No failure or delay by us to exercise or enforce any right or benefit under this Agreement shall be deemed a waiver of such right or benefit, nor operate to prevent or limit the future exercise or enforcement of that right or benefit. If any term or condition of this Agreement is held invalid, void or otherwise unenforceable by any court, governmental agency or authority of competent jurisdiction, the remainder of this Agreement shall remain valid and enforceable. The parties are independent contractors and nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed to create any joint venture or agency relationship among the parties, and no party shall have the right to enter into contracts on behalf of, to legally bind, to incur debt on behalf of, or to otherwise incur any liability or obligation on behalf of, the other party.

Contact Us:

If you have an inquiry regarding the DBm-Health App, please contact us as follows:

Address: Schrödinger Building Heatley Road, Oxford Science Park, Oxford, England, OX4 4GE

Email: Dbm-support@sensynehealth.com
legal.patient_notice_content:
DBm-Health App NOTICE TO NHS PATIENTS

Sensyne Health Group Limited ('Sensyne') provides certain services to NHS Trusts to support the delivery of patient care by a NHS Trust to patients who suffer from or are at risk of diabetes.

Please note that the collection and use of your personal data will be subject to any applicable privacy policies and disclosures of your NHS Trust.

Here is some key information about this app:

The DBm-Health App allows you to enter blood glucose readings and record extra information about your reading (e.g. a note to your nurse). This information is sent by the app to your NHS Trust.

You must ensure that your device has a lock. This is to protect your information.

Your NHS Trust will have access to your personal data. Your NHS Trust may contact you using the DBm-Health app.

Sensyne may access your personal data to provide the DBm-Health App to your NHS Trust.

Sensyne may also have access to anonymous non-personal data generated in connection with the DBm-Health App. This data may only be used for medical research purposes or for product improvement.

Sensyne will not use your personal data to market any products or services to you.

Please contact your NHS Trust if you have any concerns in relation to the collection and use of your data
legal.clinician_terms_content:
DBm-Health App NOTICE TO NHS AUTHORISED USERS

- New content needed -

escalation_policy.high_monitoring:
Registered nurse to immediately inform the medical team caring for the patient – this should be at least at specialist registrar level

Emergency assessment by a team with critical care competencies, including practitioner(s) with advanced airway management skills

Consider transfer of care to a level 2 or 3 clinical care facility, ie higher-dependency unit or ICU

Clinical care in an environment with monitoring facilities
escalation_policy.low_medium_monitoring: Registered nurse to inform medical team caring for the patient, who will review and decide whether escalation of care is necessary
escalation_policy.low_monitoring:
Inform registered nurse, who must assess the patient

Registered nurse decides whether increased frequency of monitoring and/or escalation of care is required
escalation_policy.medium_monitoring:
Registered nurse to immediately inform the medical team caring for the patient

Registered nurse to request urgent assessment by a clinician or team with core competencies in the care of acutely ill patients

Provide clinical care in an environment with monitoring facilities

nurse_concern.name: Pallor or Cyanosis
nurse_concern.text: Colour change in patient / extremity (pale, dusky, blue)

nurse_concern.name: New Facial/limb weakness
nurse_concern.text: Sudden loss of movement, or weakness of face or limb

nurse_concern.name: Unresolved Pain
nurse_concern.text: Unresolved or new onset of pain (undiagnosed)

nurse_concern.name: Abnormal Electrolyte/BG
nurse_concern.text: Abnormal electrolyte or blood glucose level

nurse_concern.name: Infection?
nurse_concern.text: Possible infection – fill in sepsis chart

send_config.send_terms_content:
Sensyne Health Group Limited ('Sensyne') provides certain services to your NHS Trust including the digital charting system for vital-sign observations and calculation of early warning scores known as SEND. Your use of the SEND service, accessed via any means including the web-based portal and tablet application, and any associated content (the 'SEND Solution') is governed by the agreement between Sensyne (or a relevant affiliate of Sensyne) and your NHS Trust (the 'Agreement').

By using or accessing the SEND Solution you agree to be bound by and comply with the terms of the Agreement as it relates to your use of the SEND Solution.

Please contact your NHS Trust for further details.

gdm_clinician_terms_content:
GDm-Health Solution TERMS OF USE

Sensyne Health Group Limited ('Sensyne') provides certain services to Thomas Jefferson University, D/B/A, Jefferson Health ('Jefferson Health') to support the delivery of patient care by Jefferson Health to patients at risk of gestational diabetes during pregnancy, a mobile application for patients (the 'GDm-Health App') and a web-based service (and associated content) for clinicians (the 'GDm-Health Solution'). Your use of and access to the GDm-Health Solution is governed by these terms of use (this 'Agreement'). Please read this Agreement carefully.

If you enter into this Agreement on behalf of another person (natural or legal) you represent and warrant that you have authority to do so. You also represent and warrant that you have reached the age of majority under the applicable laws of your state or locality.

THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS DISCLAIMERS OF WARRANTIES, DISCLAIMERS OF LIABILITY, AND A BINDING ARBITRATION CLAUSE AND CLASS ACTION WAIVER THAT AFFECTS YOUR RIGHTS FOR RESOLVING ANY DISPUTE WITH US, AS WELL AS AN INDEMNIFICATION PROVISION THAT MAKES YOU RESPONSIBLE FOR CERTAIN LOSSES. PLEASE READ THEM CAREFULLY.

1 THIS AGREEMENT

1.1 The GDm-Health Solution is made available to you on behalf of Jefferson Health by Sensyne Health Group Limited, a limited company incorporated and registered in England and Wales (company number 11240986) with its registered office at Schrödinger Building Heatley Road, Oxford Science Park, Oxford, England, OX4 4GE ('Sensyne', 'we', 'us'). In this Agreement, a reference to 'you' means you, in your capacity as a physician employed by Jefferson Health for whom Sensyne processes certain data in connection with Jefferson Health's provision of care to patients.

1.2 You can contact Sensyne by emailing our customer service team at support@sensynehealth.com or writing to us at the address above. If we have to contact you we may do so using the email address, postal address, or telephone number you provided to us.

1.3 We reserve the right to make changes to this Agreement at any time, in accordance with applicable law. If we make only minor changes to this Agreement without materially changing your rights or obligations, such amended Agreement will be posted on the GDm-Health Solution or through some other reasonable method and they will take effect immediately when they are posted. If you do not accept a change, then you are free to terminate this Agreement with us and stop using the GDm-Health Solution. Your use of the GDm-Health Solution following notification of a material change to you shall constitute your acceptance of those changes. Certain provisions of this Agreement may be supplemented or superseded by expressly designated legal notices or terms located on particular pages within the GDm-Health Solution and we will use reasonable efforts to make you aware of such legal notices and/or terms. 

2 LICENSE AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY ('IP') 

2.1 We grant you a personal, non-transferable and non-exclusive right and license to access and use the GDm-Health Solution for your personal and non-commercial use and for its intended use only. Any software provided through or used to operate the GDm-Health Solution is licensed, not sold, to you by us and such license is limited to object code only. We may notify you, by notice within the software or otherwise, that the software contains software governed by the license of a third party and you agree to abide by the terms and condition of the same. You must not rent, lease, lend, sell, redistribute, sublicense, copy, reverse engineer, decompile, translate, modify, rent, use as a service bureau, lease, sublicense, distribute copies of, adapt, or create derivative works based on such software.

2.2 The trademarks 'GDm', 'GDm-Health' and any other trademark used in the GDm-Health Solution are our trademarks or those of our licensors and you may not use or display such trademarks without our permission. 

2.3 With respect to content you submit or make available through the GDm-Health Solution ('User Content'), you grant us a worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free and non-exclusive license to use such User Content for the purpose of providing and enhancing the GDm-Health Solution. 

3 YOUR OBLIGATIONS

3.1 To use the GDm-Health Solution, you must complete a registration form or a similar form to create an account. When you access your account you agree to provide true, accurate, current and complete information about yourself as prompted by the registration form or otherwise requested during the term of this Agreement, and to maintain and promptly update that information so as to keep that information true, accurate, current and complete. You consent and authorize us to verify the information that you provide.

3.2 The GDm-Health Solution contains information relating to patient medical conditions. You acknowledge and agree that the GDm-Health Solution and GDm-Health App are solely tools to assist you in clinical decision-making. They are not a substitute for your own clinical judgment as a healthcare professional. No clinical decisions are to be based solely on the GDm-Health Solution or GDm-Health App, but are to include consideration of clinical history, symptoms, other diagnostic measurements, and other factors that you may deem relevant in your clinical judgment. You, and specifically not Sensyne or the GDm-Health Solution, are solely responsible for verifying the accuracy of all patient information and determining the data necessary for you to make clinical decisions, as well as for complying with all applicable laws, regulations and licensing requirements applicable to your delivery of healthcare services.

3.3 You agree not to represent that the GDm-Health Solution or GDm-Health App is a medical device, pharmaceutical product or diagnostic product of any kind whatsoever, nor promote or market the GDm-Health Solution or GDm-Health App as such in any way or to any person. Without limiting the foregoing, you agree not to represent that the GDm-Health Solution or GDm-Health App is intended for use in the diagnosis of disease or other conditions or in the cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease, or is intended to affect the structure or function of the body, nor promote or market the GDm-Health Solution or GDm-Health App as such in any way or to any person.

3.4 You agree not to use the GDm-Health Solution to: (a) upload, post, email, transmit or otherwise make available any content that is unlawful, harmful, threatening, abusive, harassing, tortious, defamatory, vulgar, obscene, libelous, invasive of another's privacy, hateful, or racially, ethnically or otherwise illegal or objectionable; (b) impersonate any person or entity, including, but not limited to, a Sensyne employee or falsely state or otherwise misrepresent your affiliation with a person or entity; (c) transmit or otherwise make available any content that you do not have a right to make available, that contains software viruses or any other computer code, files or programs designed to interrupt, destroy or limit the functionality of any computer software or hardware or telecommunications equipment; (d) interfere with or disrupt the GDm-Health Solution or servers or networks connected to the GDm-Health Solution; and/or (e) violate any applicable local, state, federal or international law. 

3.5 You are solely responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your information and for restricting access to your devices. You accept responsibility for all activities that occur under your account or from your devices. You agree to immediately notify us if you have reason to believe there has been any unauthorized use of your account or password, or any other breach of security, and acknowledge that we may not be able to mitigate such unauthorized access or other breach of security until you do so. We may revoke or deactivate your account at any time.

3.6 You consent to transact with Sensyne electronically and receive legal notices and other communications electronically, either by e-mail, text messaging, push notifications (in accordance with your device settings), or by notices posted on the GDm-Health Solution. You agree that any requirement that a communication be sent to you in writing is satisfied by such electronic communication and that you are responsible for maintaining an Internet browser, mobile device or computing equipment capable of accessing the GDm-Health Solution. 

4 WARRANTIES AND DISCLAIMER

4.1 WE MAKE NO REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY OTHER THAN AS EXPRESSLY SET OUT IN THIS AGREEMENT. TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, WE DISCLAIM AND EXCLUDE ALL CONDITIONS OR WARRANTIES THAT MAY OTHERWISE BE IMPLIED BY APPLICABLE LAW INTO THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, CONDITIONS OR WARRANTIES AS TO TITLE, MERCHANTABILITY, SATISFACTORY QUALITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT; ALL SERVICES ARE PROVIDED ON AN 'AS IS', 'AS AVAILABLE', AND 'WITH ALL FAULTS' BASIS. SENSYNE MAKES NO WARRANTY THAT THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION SHALL BE AVAILABLE AT ALL TIMES, OR IS FREE OF ERRORS. WE MAKE NO REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY ABOUT THE SECURITY OF THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION OR ABOUT THE ACCURACY, RELIABILITY, COMPLETENESS, CURRENTNESS, SUITABILITY OR TIMELINESS OF INFORMATION AVAILABLE THROUGH THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION ANY AND ALL SOFTWARE, TEXT, GRAPHICS, TOOLS, LINKS, RECOMMENDATIONS OR OTHER COMMUNICATIONS PROVIDED IN OR THROUGH THE USE OF THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION. YOU ASSUME ALL RISK FOR ANY DAMAGE TO YOUR MOBILE DEVICE OR COMPUTER SYSTEM OR LOSS OF DATA THAT RESULTS FROM OBTAINING ANY CONTENT FROM THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION, INCLUDING ANY DAMAGES RESULTING FROM VIRUSES. TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED UNDER APPLICABLE LAW, YOU AGREE THAT SENSYNE WILL HAVE NO RESPONSIBILITY OR LIABILITY FOR ANY INFORMATION, SOFTWARE, OR MATERIALS FOUND AT ANY THIRD-PARTY WEBSITE OR SERVICE (INCLUDING WEBSITES AND SERVICES LINKED TO OR FROM THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION).

4.2 NO ADVICE OR INFORMATION, WHETHER ORAL OR WRITTEN, OBTAINED BY YOU FROM SENSYNE OR THROUGH OR FROM THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION SHALL CREATE ANY WARRANTY NOT EXPRESSLY STATED IN THIS AGREEMENT. THIS AGREEMENT IS WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO AND IN NO WAY LIMITS OR SUBSTITUTES ANY OBLIGATIONS THAT MAY BE OWED BY YOU AS A HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONAL UNDER YOUR LICENSE TO PRACTICE, INCLUDING ANY OBLIGATIONS OF MEDICAL CONFIDENTIALITY, UNDER APPLICABLE LAWS.

5 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

5.1 Nothing in this Agreement shall limit or exclude any liability that, under applicable law, cannot be limited or excluded. 

5.2 TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, SENSYNE DISCLAIMS AND WILL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, DIRECT, INDIRECT, PUNITIVE, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOSS OF BUSINESS, REVENUE, PROFITS, GOODWILL, OR OTHER ECONOMIC ADVANTAGE)) ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH (A) YOUR ENTRY OF DATA INTO THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION, (B) STATEMENTS OR CONDUCT OF ANY THIRD PARTY ON THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION, (C) STOPPAGE OF USE BY YOU DURING OR AFTER COMMENCEMENT OF USEOF THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION, (D) THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION, (E) ANY FAILURE OF PERFORMANCE, ERROR, OMISSION, INTERRUPTION, EFFECT, DELAY OR DEFECT IN OPERATION OR TRANSMISSION, VIRUS, LINE SYSTEM FAILURE, OR LOSS OF USE RELATED TO THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION OR, (F) OTHERWISE ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER BASED ON WARRANTY, CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), OR ANY OTHER LEGAL THEORY, AND EVEN IF SENSYNE HAS PREVIOUSLY BEEN ADVISED OF, OR REASONABLY COULD HAVE FORESEEN, THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. IF YOU ARE DISSATISFIED WITH THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION OR THIS AGREEMENT, YOUR SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY IS TO DISCONTINUE USE OF THE GDm-HEALTH SOLUTION. TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, OUR AGGREGATE LIABILITY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT IS LIMITED TO $100. 

5.3 YOU AGREE THAT TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, SENSYNE IS NOT RESPONSIBLE OR LIABLE FOR ANY LOSS OR DAMAGE OF ANY SORT INCURRED AS THE RESULT OF ANY DEALINGS WITH ANY CLINICAL TRIAL, PATIENT, LABORATORY, OR OTHER ENTITY THAT YOU USE OR CONSULT WITH, INCLUDING IN RELATION TO JEFFERSON HEALTH.

6 INDEMNITY

6.1 You promise to compensate us fully against any claim or demand, including reasonable legal fees, made by any third party due to or arising out of your use of the GDm-Health Solution (including claims arising out of or in connection with the provision of healthcare services or related services to your patients), your breach of this Agreement, your violation of any applicable laws, or your violation of any rights of another person or entity. 

7 TERMINATION AND SUSPENSION

7.1 You may terminate this Agreement at any time by contacting Jefferson Health. They will be responsible for removing you, and any of your data, from the GDm-Health Solution. If you terminate this Agreement, you will no longer be able to use the GDm-Health Solution. 

7.2 We may terminate this Agreement and/or your access to the GDm-Health Solution immediately where we have reasonable ground to do so due to: (i) your breach of this Agreement; (ii) requests by law enforcement or other government agencies; (iii) our discontinuation of or material modification to the GDm-Health Solution; (iv) unexpected technical or security issues or problems; and (v) your extended periods of inactivity. Termination of your account may include (i) removal of access to all offerings within the GDm-Health Solution, (ii) deletion of your information, files and content associated with or inside your account, and (iii) barring of further use of the GDm-Health Solution. You agree that all such suspension, change or termination by us shall be made in our sole discretion and that to the extent permitted by applicable law we shall not be liable to you or any third party for any suspension, change or termination of your account or access to the GDm-Health Solution for any reason.

8 GOVERNING LAW; MANDATORY ARBITRATION

8.1 PLEASE READ THIS SECTION CAREFULLY BECAUSE IT AFFECTS YOUR RIGHTS. BY AGREEING TO MANDATORY, BINDING ARBITRATION, YOU WAIVE YOUR RIGHT TO LITIGATE DISPUTES THROUGH A COURT AND TO HAVE A JUDGE OR JURY DECIDE YOUR CASE.

8.2 This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the United States and the State of New York, without regards to the conflicts of law principles thereof. By using the GDm-Health Solution, you waive any claims that may arise under the laws of other states, countries, territories, or jurisdictions.

8.3 In order to expedite the resolution and control the cost of disputes, Sensyne and you agree that any legal or equitable claim, dispute, action or proceeding arising from or related to the GDm-Health Solution ('Dispute') will be resolved as follows to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law as follows:

(a) In the event of a Dispute, you or Sensyne must give the other a notice of Dispute, which is a written statement that sets forth the name, address, and contact information of the party giving it, the facts giving rise to the Dispute, and a proposed solution.  You must send any notice of Dispute by email to Sensyne at support@sensynehealth.com.  Sensyne will send any notice of Dispute to you by email to the email address that you have provided to Sensyne. You and Sensyne will attempt to resolve any Dispute through informal negotiation within 60 days from the date the notice of Dispute is sent. After 60 days, you or Sensyne may commence arbitration subject to the terms below.

(b) EXCEPT FOR DISPUTES THAT QUALIFY TO BE HEARD IN SMALL CLAIMS COURT, ALL DISPUTES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY ASPECT OF THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN YOU, ON THE ONE HAND, AND ANY OF SENSYNE, ITS AFFILIATES, ITS LICENSORS, OR ITS SUPPLIERS, ON THE OTHER HAND, WHETHER BASED IN CONTRACT, TORT, STATUTE, FRAUD, MISREPRESENTATION, OR ANY OTHER THEORY, WILL BE RESOLVED THROUGH FINAL AND BINDING ARBITRATION BEFORE A NEUTRAL ARBITRATOR INSTEAD OF IN A COURT BY A JUDGE OR JURY. YOU AGREE THAT SENSYNE AND YOU ARE EACH WAIVING THE RIGHT TO TRIAL BY A JURY. YOU AGREE THAT ANY ARBITRATION WILL TAKE PLACE ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS ONLY; CLASS ARBITRATIONS AND CLASS ACTIONS AND OTHER REPRESENTATIVE ACTIONS ARE NOT PERMITTED, AND YOU ARE AGREEING TO GIVE UP THE ABILITY TO PARTICIPATE IN A CLASS ACTION OR OTHER REPRESENTATIVE ACTION IN COURT.

(c) The arbitration will be administered by the American Arbitration Association (the 'AAA') under the Consumer Arbitration Rules (the 'Rules') (available from the AAA at www.adr.org), as amended by this Agreement. The arbitrator will conduct hearings, if any, by teleconference or videoconference, rather than by personal appearances, unless the arbitrator determines upon request by you or by us that an in-person hearing is appropriate. Any in-person appearances will be held at a location that is reasonably convenient to both parties with due consideration of their ability to travel and other pertinent circumstances. If the parties are unable to agree on a location, such determination should be made by the AAA or by the arbitrator. If you are able to demonstrate that the costs of arbitration will be prohibitive as compared to the costs of litigation, Sensyne will pay as much of your filing and hearing fees in connection with the arbitration as the arbitrator deems necessary to prevent the arbitration from being cost-prohibitive. The arbitrator's decision will be based on this Agreement, when not in conflict with applicable law, and will be final and binding. The arbitrator will have authority to award temporary, interim or permanent injunctive relief or relief providing for specific performance of this Agreement, but only to the extent necessary to provide relief warranted by the individual claim before the arbitrator. If the arbitrator decides that either the substance of your claim or the remedy you asked for is frivolous or brought for an improper purpose, then Sensyne may use the Rules to determine whether you are responsible for the filing, administrative and arbitrator fees. The award rendered by the arbitrator may be confirmed and enforced in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Notwithstanding any of the foregoing, nothing in this Agreement will preclude you from bringing issues to the attention of federal, state or local agencies.

9 GENERAL

9.1 This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between you and us relating to its subject matter and supersedes any prior agreements, undertakings, representations, warranties and arrangements of any nature, relating to the same. Each party acknowledges that it has not been induced to enter into this Agreement by any representation or warranty other than those contained in this Agreement. 

9.2 You must not use, export or re-export the GDm-Health Solution contrary to the export laws of the UK, USA and any other jurisdiction including without limitation the Export Administration Regulations of the USA. 

9.3 We may assign this Agreement, in whole or in part without notice to you or your consent. No person who is not a party to this Agreement shall have any rights under any law to enforce any term of this Agreement and no consent is required from any third party to change this Agreement. We shall not be in breach of this Agreement or otherwise liable to you as a result of any delay or failure in the performance of our obligations under this Agreement to the extent that such delay or failure is caused by occurrences beyond our reasonable control including, but not limited to, acts of God, strikes, war or sabotage and the time for performance of the relevant obligation shall be extended accordingly. No failure or delay by us to exercise or enforce any right or benefit under this Agreement shall be deemed a waiver of such right or benefit, nor operate to prevent or limit the future exercise or enforcement of that right or benefit. If any term or condition of this Agreement is held invalid, void or otherwise unenforceable by any court, governmental agency or authority of competent jurisdiction, the remainder of this Agreement shall remain valid and enforceable. The parties are independent contractors and nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed to create any joint venture or agency relationship among the parties, and no party shall have the right to enter into contracts on behalf of, to legally bind, to incur debt on behalf of, or to otherwise incur any liability or obligation on behalf of, the other party.

If you have an inquiry regarding the GDm-Health Solution, please contact us as follows:

Address: Schrödinger Building Heatley Road, Oxford Science Park, Oxford, England, OX4 4GE

Email: support@sensynehealth.com

Effective Date: 10 December 2019
gdm_terms_content:
GDm-Health App NOTICE TO JEFFERSON HEALTH PATIENTS

Sensyne Health Group Limited ('Sensyne') provides certain services to Thomas Jefferson University, D/B/A, Jefferson Health ('Jefferson Health') to support the delivery of patient care by Jefferson Health to patients at risk of gestational diabetes during pregnancy. 

Please note that the collection and use of your personal data will be subject to any applicable privacy policies and disclosures of Jefferson Health. 

Here is some key information about this app:

- The GDm-Health App allows you to enter blood glucose readings and record extra information about your reading (e.g., a note to your nurse). This information is sent by the app to Jefferson Health. 

- You must ensure that your device is secured by a passcode. This is to protect your information. 

- Jefferson Health will have access to your personal data. Jefferson Health may contact you using the GDm-Health App. 

- Sensyne may access your personal data to provide the GDm-Health App to Jefferson Health. 

- Sensyne may also have access to anonymous non-personal data generated in connection with the GDm-Health App. This data may only be used for medical research purposes or for product improvement. 

- Sensyne will not use your personal data to market any products or services to you. 

- Please contact Jefferson Health if you have any concerns in relation to the collection and use of your data.

GDm-Health App TERMS OF USE

Please read these terms of use (this 'Agreement') carefully as you will be bound by this Agreement if you use or access the GDm-Health mobile application ('GDm-Health App'). If you enter into this Agreement on behalf of another person (natural or legal) you represent and warrant that you have authority to do so. You also represent and warrant that you have reached the age of majority under the applicable laws of your state or locality.

THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS DISCLAIMERS OF WARRANTIES, DISCLAIMERS OF LIABILITY, AND A BINDING ARBITRATION CLAUSE AND CLASS ACTION WAIVER THAT AFFECTS YOUR RIGHTS FOR RESOLVING ANY DISPUTE WITH US, AS WELL AS AN INDEMNIFICATION PROVISION THAT MAKES YOU RESPONSIBLE FOR CERTAIN LOSSES. PLEASE READ THEM CAREFULLY.

1 THIS AGREEMENT

1.1 The GDm-Health App is made available to you on behalf of  Thomas Jefferson University, D/B/A, Jefferson Health ('Jefferson Health') by Sensyne Health Group Limited, a limited company incorporated and registered in England and Wales (company number 11240986) with its registered office at Schrödinger Building Heatley Road, Oxford Science Park, Oxford, England, OX4 4GE ('Sensyne', 'we', 'us'). In this Agreement, a reference to 'you' means you, in your capacity as a patient of Jefferson Health for whom Sensyne processes certain data in connection with Jefferson Health's provision of care to patients.

1.2 You can contact Sensyne by emailing our customer service team at support@sensynehealth.com or writing to us at the address above. If we have to contact you we may do so using the email address, postal address, or telephone number you provided to us. 

1.3 We reserve the right to make changes to this Agreement at any time, in accordance with applicable law. If we make only minor changes to this Agreement without materially changing your rights or obligations, such amended Agreement will be posted on the GDm-Health App or through some other reasonable method and they will take effect immediately when they are posted. If you do not accept a change, then you are free to terminate this Agreement with us and stop using the GDm-Health App. Your use of the GDm-Health App following notification of a material change to you shall constitute your acceptance of those changes. Certain provisions of this Agreement may be supplemented or superseded by expressly designated legal notices or terms located on particular pages within the GDm-Health App and we will use reasonable efforts to make you aware of such legal notices and/or terms. 

2 LICENSE AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY ('IP') 

2.1 We grant you a personal, non-transferable and non-exclusive right and license to access and use the GDm-Health App for your personal and non-commercial use and for its intended use only. Any software provided through or used to operate the GDm-Health App is licensed, not sold, to you by us and such license is limited to object code only. We may notify you, by notice within the software or otherwise, that the software contains software governed by the license of a third party and you agree to abide by the terms and condition of the same. You must not rent, lease, lend, sell, redistribute, sublicense, copy, reverse engineer, decompile, translate, modify, rent, use as a service bureau, lease, sublicense, distribute copies of, adapt, or create derivative works based on such software.

2.2 The trademarks 'GDm', 'GDm-Health' and any other trademark used in the GDm-Health App are our trademarks or those of our licensors and you may not use or display such trademarks without our permission. 

2.3 With respect to content you submit or make available through the GDm-Health App ('User Content'), you grant us a worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free and non-exclusive license to use such User Content for the purpose of providing and enhancing the GDm-Health App. 

3 YOUR OBLIGATIONS

3.1 To use the GDm-Health App, your Jefferson Health physician must complete a registration form or a similar form to create an account. When you access your account you agree to provide true, accurate, current and complete information about yourself as prompted by the registration form or otherwise requested during the term of this Agreement, and to maintain and promptly update that information so as to keep that information true, accurate, current and complete. You consent and authorize us to verify the information that you provide.

3.2 You agree not to use the GDm-Health App to: (a) upload, post, email, transmit or otherwise make available any content that is unlawful, harmful, threatening, abusive, harassing, tortious, defamatory, vulgar, obscene, libelous, invasive of another's privacy, hateful, or racially, ethnically or otherwise illegal or objectionable; (b) impersonate any person or entity, including, but not limited to, a Sensyne employee or falsely state or otherwise misrepresent your affiliation with a person or entity; (c) transmit or otherwise make available any content that you do not have a right to make available, that contains software viruses or any other computer code, files or programs designed to interrupt, destroy or limit the functionality of any computer software or hardware or telecommunications equipment; (d) interfere with or disrupt the GDm-Health App or servers or networks connected to the GDm-Health App; and/or (e) violate any applicable local, state, federal or international law. 

3.3 You are solely responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your information and for restricting access to your devices. You accept responsibility for all activities that occur under your account or from your devices. You agree to immediately notify us if you have reason to believe there has been any unauthorized use or your account or password, or any other breach of security, and acknowledge that we may not be able to mitigate such unauthorized access or other breach of security until you do so. We may revoke or deactivate your account at any time.

3.4 You consent to transact with Sensyne electronically and receive legal notices and other communications electronically, either by e-mail, text messaging, push notifications (in accordance with your device settings), or by notices posted on the GDm-Health App. You agree that any requirement that a communication be sent to you in writing is satisfied by such electronic communication and that you are responsible for maintaining an Internet browser, mobile device or computing equipment capable of accessing the GDm-Health App. 

4 WARRANTIES AND DISCLAIMER

4.1 WE MAKE NO REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY OTHER THAN AS EXPRESSLY SET OUT IN THIS AGREEMENT. TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, WE DISCLAIM AND EXCLUDE ALL CONDITIONS OR WARRANTIES THAT MAY OTHERWISE BE IMPLIED BY APPLICABLE LAW INTO THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, CONDITIONS OR WARRANTIES AS TO TITLE, MERCHANTABILITY, SATISFACTORY QUALITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT; ALL SERVICES ARE PROVIDED ON AN 'AS IS', 'AS AVAILABLE', AND 'WITH ALL FAULTS' BASIS. SENSYNE MAKES NO WARRANTY THAT THE GDm-HEALTH APP SHALL BE AVAILABLE AT ALL TIMES, OR IS FREE OF ERRORS. WE MAKE NO REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY ABOUT THE SECURITY OF THE GDm-HEALTH APP OR ABOUT THE ACCURACY, RELIABILITY, COMPLETENESS, CURRENTNESS, SUITABILITY OR TIMELINESS OF INFORMATION AVAILABLE THROUGH THE GDm-HEALTH APP, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION ANY AND ALL SOFTWARE, TEXT, GRAPHICS, TOOLS, LINKS, RECOMMENDATIONS OR OTHER COMMUNICATIONS PROVIDED IN OR THROUGH THE USE OF THE GDm-HEALTH APP. YOU ASSUME ALL RISK FOR ANY DAMAGE TO YOUR MOBILE DEVICE OR COMPUTER SYSTEM OR LOSS OF DATA THAT RESULTS FROM OBTAINING ANY CONTENT FROM THE GDm-HEALTH APP, INCLUDING ANY DAMAGES RESULTING FROM VIRUSES. TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED UNDER APPLICABLE LAW, YOU AGREE THAT SENSYNE WILL HAVE NO RESPONSIBILITY OR LIABILITY FOR ANY INFORMATION, SOFTWARE, OR MATERIALS FOUND AT ANY THIRD-PARTY WEBSITE OR SERVICE (INCLUDING WEBSITES AND SERVICES LINKED TO OR FROM THE GDm-HEALTH APP).

4.2 You expressly agree that Sensyne is not providing, and does not intend to provide, medical advice through the GDm-Health App and that this is the responsibility of your physician or other medical professionals. The GDm-Health App (including any generic content supplied within the GDm-Health App) is not intended to be used in place of professional medical advice, judgment, diagnosis, or treatment, including the advice of your physician or other medical professionals, or a visit, call or consultation with your physician or other medical professionals. Should you have any health-related issues or questions during your use of the GDm-Health App, please call or see your physician or other healthcare provider promptly. The GDm-Health App does not constitute or create a doctor-patient, therapist-patient or other healthcare professional relationship between you and Sensyne. Never disregard professional medical advice or delay in seeking it because of something read or learned through the use of the GDm-Health App or any information stored on, generated by or received through the GDm-Health App. Do not use the GDm-Health App for emergency medical needs. If you experience a medical emergency, call 911 immediately. If you need non-emergency medical treatment, please contact your physician directly.

5 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

5.1 Nothing in this Agreement shall limit or exclude any liability that, under applicable law, cannot be limited or excluded. 

5.2 TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, SENSYNE DISCLAIMS AND WILL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, DIRECT, INDIRECT, PUNITIVE, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOSS OF BUSINESS, REVENUE, PROFITS, GOODWILL, OR OTHER ECONOMIC ADVANTAGE)) ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH (A) YOUR ENTRY OF DATA INTO THE GDm-HEALTH APP, (B) STATEMENTS OR CONDUCT OF ANY THIRD PARTY ON THE GDm-HEALTH APP, (C) STOPPAGE OF USE BY YOU DURING OR AFTER COMMENCEMENT OF USE OF THE GDm-HEALTH APP, (D) THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE THE GDm-HEALTH APP, (E) ANY FAILURE OF PERFORMANCE, ERROR, OMISSION, INTERRUPTION, EFFECT, DELAY OR DEFECT IN OPERATION OR TRANSMISSION, VIRUS, LINE SYSTEM FAILURE, OR LOSS OF USE RELATED TO THE GDm-HEALTH APP, OR (F) OTHERWISE ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER BASED ON WARRANTY, CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), OR ANY OTHER LEGAL THEORY, AND EVEN IF SENSYNE HAS PREVIOUSLY BEEN ADVISED OF, OR REASONABLY COULD HAVE FORESEEN, THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. IF YOU ARE DISSATISFIED WITH THE GDm-HEALTH APP OR THIS AGREEMENT, YOUR SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY IS TO REMOVE THE GDm-HEALTH APP FROM YOUR MOBILE DEVICE AND DISCONTINUE ITS USE.  TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, OUR AGGREGATE LIABILITY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT IS LIMITED TO $100. 

5.3 YOU AGREE THAT TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, SENSYNE IS NOT RESPONSIBLE OR LIABLE FOR ANY LOSS OR DAMAGE OF ANY SORT INCURRED AS THE RESULT OF ANY DEALINGS WITH ANY CLINICAL TRIAL, HEALTH CARE PROVIDER, LABORATORY, OR OTHER ENTITY THAT YOU USE OR CONSULT WITH, INCLUDING IN RELATION TO JEFFERSON HEALTH.

6 INDEMNITY

6.1 You promise to compensate us fully against any claim or demand, including reasonable legal fees, made by any third party due to or arising out of your use of the GDm-Health App, your breach of this Agreement, your violation of any applicable laws, or your violation of any rights of another person or entity. 

7 TERMINATION AND SUSPENSION

7.1 You may terminate this Agreement at any time by contacting Jefferson Health physician. They will be responsible for removing you, and any of your data, from the GDm-Health App. If you terminate this Agreement, you will no longer be able to use the GDm-Health App. 

7.2 We may terminate this Agreement and/or your access to the GDm-Health App immediately where we have reasonable ground to do so due to: (i) your breach of this Agreement; (ii) requests by law enforcement or other government agencies; (iii) our discontinuation of or material modification to the GDm-Health App; (iv) unexpected technical or security issues or problems; and (v) your extended periods of inactivity. Termination of your account may include (i) removal of access to all offerings within the GDm-Health App, (ii) deletion of your information, files and content associated with or inside your account, and (iii) barring of further use of the GDm-Health App. You agree that all such suspension, change or termination by us shall be made in our sole discretion and that to the extent permitted by applicable law we shall not be liable to you or any third party for any suspension, change or termination of your account or access to the GDm-Health App for any reason.

8 GOVERNING LAW; MANDATORY ARBITRATION

8.1 PLEASE READ THIS SECTION CAREFULLY BECAUSE IT AFFECTS YOUR RIGHTS. BY AGREEING TO MANDATORY, BINDING ARBITRATION, YOU WAIVE YOUR RIGHT TO LITIGATE DISPUTES THROUGH A COURT AND TO HAVE A JUDGE OR JURY DECIDE YOUR CASE.

8.2 This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the United States and the State of New York, without regards to the conflicts of law principles thereof. By using the GDm-Health App, you waive any claims that may arise under the laws of other states, countries, territories, or jurisdictions.

8.3 EXCEPT FOR DISPUTES THAT QUALIFY TO BE HEARD IN SMALL CLAIMS COURT, ALL DISPUTES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY ASPECT OF THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN YOU, ON THE ONE HAND, AND ANY OF SENSYNE, ITS AFFILIATES, ITS LICENSORS, OR ITS SUPPLIERS, ON THE OTHER HAND, WHETHER BASED IN CONTRACT, TORT, STATUTE, FRAUD, MISREPRESENTATION, OR ANY OTHER THEORY, WILL BE RESOLVED THROUGH FINAL AND BINDING ARBITRATION BEFORE A NEUTRAL ARBITRATOR INSTEAD OF IN A COURT BY A JUDGE OR JURY. YOU AGREE THAT SENSYNE AND YOU ARE EACH WAIVING THE RIGHT TO TRIAL BY A JURY. YOU AGREE THAT ANY ARBITRATION WILL TAKE PLACE ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS ONLY; CLASS ARBITRATIONS AND CLASS ACTIONS AND OTHER REPRESENTATIVE ACTIONS ARE NOT PERMITTED, AND YOU ARE AGREEING TO GIVE UP THE ABILITY TO PARTICIPATE IN A CLASS ACTION OR OTHER REPRESENTATIVE ACTION IN COURT.

8.4 The arbitration will be administered by the American Arbitration Association (the 'AAA') under the Consumer Arbitration Rules (the 'Rules') (available from the AAA at www.adr.org), as amended by this Agreement. The arbitrator will conduct hearings, if any, by teleconference or videoconference, rather than by personal appearances, unless the arbitrator determines upon request by you or by us that an in-person hearing is appropriate. Any in-person appearances will be held at a location that is reasonably convenient to both parties with due consideration of their ability to travel and other pertinent circumstances. If the parties are unable to agree on a location, such determination should be made by the AAA or by the arbitrator. If you are able to demonstrate that the costs of arbitration will be prohibitive as compared to the costs of litigation, Sensyne will pay as much of your filing and hearing fees in connection with the arbitration as the arbitrator deems necessary to prevent the arbitration from being cost-prohibitive. The arbitrator's decision will be based on this Agreement, when not in conflict with applicable law, and will be final and binding. The arbitrator will have authority to award temporary, interim or permanent injunctive relief or relief providing for specific performance of this Agreement, but only to the extent necessary to provide relief warranted by the individual claim before the arbitrator. If the arbitrator decides that either the substance of your claim or the remedy you asked for is frivolous or brought for an improper purpose, then Sensyne may use the Rules to determine whether you are responsible for the filing, administrative and arbitrator fees. The award rendered by the arbitrator may be confirmed and enforced in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Notwithstanding any of the foregoing, nothing in this Agreement will preclude you from bringing issues to the attention of federal, state or local agencies. 

9 GENERAL

9.1 This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between you and us relating to its subject matter and supersedes any prior agreements, undertakings, representations, warranties and arrangements of any nature, relating to the same. Each party acknowledges that it has not been induced to enter into this Agreement by any representation or warranty other than those contained in this Agreement. 

9.2 You must not use, export or re-export the GDm-Health App contrary to the export laws of the UK, USA and any other jurisdiction including without limitation the Export Administration Regulations of the USA. You represent and warrant that (i) you are not located in a country that is subject to a US Government embargo, or that has been designated by the US Government as a 'terrorist supporting' country; and (ii) you are not listed on any US Government list of prohibited or restricted parties.

9.3 We may assign this Agreement, in whole or in part without notice to you or your consent. No person who is not a party to this Agreement shall have any rights under any law to enforce any term of this Agreement and no consent is required from any third party to change this Agreement. We shall not be in breach of this Agreement or otherwise liable to you as a result of any delay or failure in the performance of our obligations under this Agreement to the extent that such delay or failure is caused by occurrences beyond our reasonable control including, but not limited to, acts of God, strikes, war or sabotage and the time for performance of the relevant obligation shall be extended accordingly. No failure or delay by us to exercise or enforce any right or benefit under this Agreement shall be deemed a waiver of such right or benefit, nor operate to prevent or limit the future exercise or enforcement of that right or benefit. If any term or condition of this Agreement is held invalid, void or otherwise unenforceable by any court, governmental agency or authority of competent jurisdiction, the remainder of this Agreement shall remain valid and enforceable.

The parties are independent contractors and nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed to create any joint venture or agency relationship among the parties, and no party shall have the right to enter into contracts on behalf of, to legally bind, to incur debt on behalf of, or to otherwise incur any liability or obligation on behalf of, the other party.
